bibl.title: A New Roman Auxiliary Cohort in Egypt? P. Egypt. Mus. Inv. S.R. 3055.
bibl.note: Investigates the equestrian military career of the archidikastes Iulius Vestinianus Asklepiades, qui et Leonidas, mentioned in P. Cair. Inv. SR 3055 [ed.: Alia HANAFI, Three Applications from Oxyrhynchus, Proceedings of the XIXth International Congress of Papyrology. I (Cairo, 1992) pp. 561-577]. He was praefectus cohortis III Bracarum in Syria about 120 A.D.; thereafter he held a second militia prima as praefectus cohortis I Thracum in Syria, or in Egypt.
bibl.seg: DEVIJVER Hubert, A New Roman Auxiliary Cohort in Egypt? P. Egypt. Mus. Inv. S.R. 3055.

Investigates the equestrian military career of the archidikastes Iulius Vestinianus Asklepiades, qui et Leonidas, mentioned in P. Cair. Inv. SR 3055 [ed.: Alia HANAFI, Three Applications from Oxyrhynchus, Proceedings of the XIXth International Congress of Papyrology. I (Cairo, 1992) pp. 561-577]. He was praefectus cohortis III Bracarum in Syria about 120 A.D.; thereafter he held a second militia prima as praefectus cohortis I Thracum in Syria, or in Egypt.
